cards.name: Dragon Pole (beta)
cards.text: You have 2 additional arcane slot. [action]: Fight. You get +1 [combat] for this attack for each of your arcane slots that is filled. If at least 2 of your arcane slots are filled, this attack deals +1 damage. If you succeed, you may place the top card of your deck facedown in your play area, as an Audra (It takes up an arcane slot. If it leaves play, add it to your hand.) Card designed by the Pride of Arkham

cards.name: Alice Luxley (beta)
cards.text: You get +1 [intellect]. [reaction] After horror is placed in Alice Luxley: Your location gets -2 shroud until the end of the active investigator's turn. [reaction] After you discover a clue, exhaust Alice Luxley: Deal 1 damage to an enemy at your location. Card designed by the Pride of Arkham

cards.back_flavor: Carson Sinclair has served three generations of the Webb family in Arkham. Always proper, Carson watched with disapproval as his most recent employer, Hercule Webb, began bringing bizarre artifacts and profane tomes into the house, aided in these endeavors by Webb's business manager, Dupuis. When Mr. Webb was swallowed by a dimensional rift, no one believed Carson's description of the harrowing event. Carson has devoted himself to proving Dupuis's guilt, and to restoring the children as the rightful heirs to the Webb fortune.
cards.back_text: Deck Size: 30. Secondary Class Choice: At deck creation, choose Seeker ([seeker]), Mystic ([mystic]), or Survivor ([survivor]). Deckbuilding Options: Guardian cards ([guardian]) level 0-5, Neutral cards level 0-5, up to 10 level 0-1 events and/or skills of your chosen secondary class. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): 2 copies of "As you wish", Selfless to a Fault, 1 random basic weakness.
cards.name: Carson Sinclair
cards.text:
You may take an additional action during your turn, which can only be used on the below [action] ability.
[action]: Choose another investigator at your location. They immediately take an action as if it were their turn. (Limit once per round for each investigator.)
[elder_sign] effect: +0. Draw 1 card. You may resolve this effect anytime another investigator at your location resolves their [elder_sign] effect.

cards.back_flavor: A refugee from French-occupied Algeria, Amina arrived in Arkham with nothing more than she could carry. Six years later, Amina's sharp mind and technical skill placed her at the switchboard for the Miskatonic Valley Telephone Company. Soon after, she began to catch snippets of something strange while at work - distorted words in an unrecognizable language, out-of-place noises, calls that connected to nowhere at all and dropped almost immediately. As the phantom calls grew in frequency, Amina sought answers. She found the right extension, connected to the line, and listened in. Despite not understanding a word of the alien language on the other side, she could tell the eldritch words held real power.
cards.back_text: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Mystic cards level 0-5, Neutral cards level 0-5, [[Charm]] cards level 0-4. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Word of Woe, Word of Weal, Deafening Silence, 1 random basic weakness.
cards.flavor: "What is it trying to tell me?"
cards.name: Amina Zidane
cards.text:
[reaction] When you play an asset: Reduce its resouce cost by 3. It enters play with 1 doom on it. (Limit once per round.)
[elder_sign] effect: +2. You may move all doom from a card at your location to another card at your location.

cards.customization_change:
If you perform an attack with attached asset against an enemy engaged with another investigator and fail, you deal no damage.
You get +2 [combat] while attacking with attached asset.
After you attach an [[Upgrade]] card other than Custom Modifications to attached asset, draw 1 card.
Fast. Play only during your turn.
After ammo is spent from or placed on attached asset by another event, place 1 ammo on attahed asset.
If you succeed by 3 or more while attacking with attached asset, this attack deals +1 damage.
cards.customization_text: □ Notched Sight. If you perform an attack with attached asset against an enemy engaged with another investigator and fail, you deal no damage. □□ Extended Stock. You get +2 [combat] while attacking with attached asset. □□ Counterbalance. After you attach an [[Upgrade]] card other than Custom Modifications to attached asset, draw 1 card. □□□ Leather Grip. Custom Modifications gets -1 cost and gains: "Fast. Play only during your turn." □□□ Extended Magazine. After ammo is spent from or placed on attached asset by another event, place 1 ammo on attahed asset. □□□□□ Quicksilver Bullets. If you succeed by 3 or more while attacking with attached asset, this attack deals +1 damage.
cards.flavor: It's like an old friend in your grip.
cards.name: Custom Modifications
cards.text:
Customizable.
Attach to a [[Firearm]] asset you control. Limit 1 per asset.
[reaction] When you reveal a non-[auto_fail] chaos token attacking with attached asset, exhaust Custom Modifications: Cancel that chaos, return it to the chaos bag, and reveal a new one.

cards.flavor: You're not about to question why it works. All you know is that you're never taking it off again.
cards.name: Obsidian Bracelet
cards.text:
Obsidian Bracelet may only be assigned damage and/or horror dealt by treachery effects.
Obsidian Bracelet may be assigned damage and/or horror dealt to other investigators at your location.

cards.name: Bolas
cards.text: Evade. Attempt to evade using [combat] instead of [agility]. If you succeed and the enemy is non-[[Elite]], attach Bolas to it. Attached enemy gets -1 evade value. Forced. - After attached enemy moves: Exhaust it.

cards.name: Breach the Door
cards.text:
Test [combat](1). If you succeed, attach Breach the Door to your location with 1 resource on it for each point you succeeded by, as leads.
Reduce attached location's shroud by 1 for each lead on Breach the Door.

cards.name: Bestow Resolve
cards.text:
Uses (4 charges).
[fast] During a skill test performed by an investigator at your location or a connecting location, spend 1 charge: Commit a non-weakness card from your hand to that skill test, treating all of its skill icons as [wild]

cards.name: Guard Dog
cards.text: [fast] Exhaust Guard Dog: Engage an enemy at your location. That enemy attacks you. [reaction] When an enemy attack deals damage and/or horror to Guard Dog: Deal 1 damage to the attacking enemy. Card design by the Council-in-Exile at Arkham Nights 2020.

cards.name: Handcuffs
cards.text: Fast. [action] If Handcuffs is not attached to an enemy: Evade. Use only on a [[Humanoid]] enemy. This evasion attempt uses [combat] instead of [agility]. If you succeed, remove all doom from the just-evaded enemy and attach Handcuffs to it. If the attached enemy is non-[[Elite]], it cannot ready and doom cannot be placed on it.

cards.name: Prepared for the Worst
cards.text: Choose an investigator at your location. That investigator search the top 9 cards of your deck for a [[Weapon]] asset, adds it to their hand or plays it (paying its resource cost), and shuffles their deck.

cards.flavor:
He had to give Logan credit:
the man knew how to gear up for Armageddon.
cards.name: Ever Vigilant
cards.text: One at a time, investigators at your location, as a group, may play up to 4 assets in total from their hands, reducing the resource cost of each by 1.

cards.name: Dissection Tools
cards.text: [reaction] After an enemy at your location is defeated: Place 1 resource (from the token pool) on this card, as evidence. While Dissection Tools has... - ... 1 or more evidence, you get +1 [agility]. - ... 2 or more evidence, you get +1 [combat]. - ... 3 or more evidence, you get +1 sanity.

cards.flavor: What follows is a true account. Would that it were not so.
cards.name: Grim Memoir
cards.text: Uses (4 secrets). [action] Spent 1 secret: Investigate. You get +2 [intellect] for this investigation. If you succeed by 2 or more, you may draw 1 card.

cards.name: Bizarre Diagnosis
cards.text:
Place 1 of your clues on your location.
Then, heal 3 damage from an investigator or [[Ally]] asset at your location.

cards.name: Analysis
cards.text: After revealing a chaos token for this skill test, you may place 1 of your clues on your location to cancel that chaos token, return it to the chaos bag, and reveal a new one. (You may do this any number of times.)

cards.flavor: It makes you feel like you know what you're doing, even when you're in way over your head.
cards.name: Lab Coat
cards.text: [reaction] When you would fail a skill test on a [seeker] card by 1 or less, exhaust Lab Coat: You succeed by 0, instead.

cards.name: Guidance
cards.text: Choose another investigator at your location who has yet to take their turn this round. During their turn this round, the chosen investigator gets +1 to each of their skills, and may take an additional action. Playing Guidance does not provoke attacks of opportunity.

cards.name: Dr. William T. Maleson
cards.text: [reaction] When any investigator draws an encounter card from the encounter deck, exhaust Dr. William T. Maleson and place 1 of your clues on your location: That investigator draws another card from the top of the encounter deck, chooses one of those 2 cards to resolve, and cancels and discards the other.

cards.flavor: It's amazing how differently everyone treats you while you're wearing one.
cards.name: Press Pass
cards.text: [reaction] After you spend 1 or more clues or place 1 or more clues on your location, exhaust Press Pass: You may spend an additional action during this turn (or your next turn if it is not currently your turn).

cards.name: Fingerprint Kit
cards.text: Uses (3 supplies). [action] Exhaust Fingerprint Kit and spend 1 supply: Investigate. You get +2 [intellect] for this investigation. If you succeed, you discover 2 additional clues at your location.

cards.customization_change:
- You take damage or horror.
- A location enters play or is revealed.
- An enemy engages you.
- A treachery enters your threat area.
- You play an asset
During the action granted by Honed Instinct, you get +2 to each of your skills.

Immediately take 2 actions as if it were your turn (one at a time). Then, remove Honed Instinct from the game. (Max once per round).
cards.customization_text: □ Reflex Response. Add the following play condition: "- You take damage or horror." □ Situational Awareness. Add the following play condition: "- A location enters play or is revealed." □ Killer Instinct. Add the following play condition: "- An enemy engages you." □ Gut Reaction. Add the following play condition: "- A treachery enters your threat area." □ Muscle Memory. Add the following play condition: "- You play an asset." □□ Sharpened Talent. During the action granted by Honed Instinct, you get +2 to each of your skills. □□□ Impulse Control. You may include up to three copies of Honed Instinct in your deck. Honed Instinct gets -1 cost. □□□□□ Force of Habit. When you play Honed Instinct, you may take 2 actions intstead of 1 (one at a time). Then, remove it from the game.
cards.name: Honed Insight
cards.text:
Customizable. Fast. Play this card only after one of the following conditions is met:
- The agenda or act advances.
- You succeed at a skill test by 3 or more.
Immediately take an action as if it were your turn (Max once per round).

cards.name: Kicking the Hornet's Nest
cards.text: Search the top 9 cards of the encounter deck for a non-[[Elite]] enemy and spawn it engaged with you (instead of its normal spawn location). Then, discover 1 clue at your location and gain X resources, where X is that enemy's health value. Shuffle the encounter deck.

cards.flavor: "Dress for the job you want, you say. What if the job I want is yours?"
cards.name: Stylish Coat
cards.text: [reaction] When you gain 1 or more resources during your turn via another player card effect, exhaust Stylish Coat: Gain 1 additional resource.

cards.name: Chuck Fergus
cards.text:
[reaction] When you play a [[Tactic]] or [[Trick]] event, exhaust Chuck Fergus: Choose one -
- That event gains fast.
- That event costs 2 fewer resources to play.
- You get +2 skill value while performing a skill test during the resolution of that event.

cards.name: Dirty Fighting
cards.text:
Limit 1 per investigator.
While attacking, parleying, or attempting to evade an exhausted enemy, you get +2 skill value.
[reaction] After you evade an enemy, exhaust Dirty Fighting: Take a fight action against that enemy. Ignore the aloof keyword for this attack.

cards.name: Trigger Man
cards.text: [reaction] After Trigger Man enters play: Attach an [[Illicit]] asset from your hand to Trigger Man (it is considered to be in play and under your control). [fast] Exhaust Trigger Man and spend 1 resource: Resolve an [action] ability on attached asset, without paying its [action] cost. Resolve that ability with a base skill value of 4.

cards.name: Clean Sneak
cards.text:
Fast. Play only during your turn.
For each exhausted non-swarm enemy at your location, choose a different option:
- Gain 2 resources.
- Deal 2 damage to that enemy.
- Discover 1 clue at your location.
- Draw 1 card.

cards.customization_change:
Customizable. Chosen skill: _____
You may play Living Ink under the control of any investigator at your location.
At the start of your turn, either remove 1 charge from Living Ink or ignore its ability for the remainder of the round. If Living Ink has no charges, discard it.
Uses (5 charges).
Additional skill: _____
Additional skill: _____
[reaction] After you reveal a chaos token with a symbol, exhaust Living Ink: Place 1 charge on it.
You get +2 to the chosen skill(s) and -1 to each other skill.
cards.customization_text: Chosen skill: □ Shifting Ink. You may play Living Ink under the control of another investigator at your location. □ Subtle Depiction. At the start of your turn, you may choose not to remove 1 charge from Living Ink and ignore its ability for the remainder of the round. □□ Imbued Ink. Living Ink enters play with 2 additional charges and takes up an arcane slot instead of a body slot. □□ Eldritch Ink. Choose another skill. □□□ Eldritch Ink. Choose another skill. □□□ Macabre Depiction. Living Ink gains: "[reaction] After you reveal a chaos token with a symbol, exhaust Living Ink: Place 1 charge on it." □□□ Vibrancy. Living Ink grants an additional +1 to the chosen skills and -1 to each other skill.
cards.name: Living Ink
cards.text:
Customizable. When you purchase Living Ink, choose a skill and circle it on its upgrade sheet.
Uses (3 charges).
Remove 1 charge from Living Ink at the start of each of your turns. If Living Ink has no charges, discard it.
You get +1 to the chosen skill(s).

cards.name: Onyx Pentacle
cards.text: [action]: Evade. Either use your [willpower] or get +1 [agility] for this evasion attempt. When you initiate this ability, choose one - Exhaust Onyx Pentacle and place 1 doom on it to target any enemy at your location or a connecting location, and get +1 skill value for this evasion attempt. - If you succeed by 2 or more, remove 1 doom from Onyx Pentacle.

cards.name: Explosive Ward
cards.text:
Before you play Explosive Ward, you may discard any number of cards from your arcane slots.
Deal X damage to a non-[[Elite]] enemy engaged with you. X cannot be greater than the number of empty arcane slots you have. This action does not provoke attacks of opportunity.

cards.name: Binder's Jar
cards.text:
You get +1 arcane slot for each enemy beneath Binder's Jar.
[reaction] After a non-[[Elite]] enemy is defeated at your location: Place that enemy facedown beneath Binder's Jar (limit 2 enemies beneath it).
[reaction] When an enemy attacks you, discard an enemy beneath Binder's Jar that shares a [[Trait]] with the attacking enemy: Cancel that attack.

cards.name: Moonlight Ritual
cards.text:
Fast. Play only during your turn.
Remove all doom from a non-[[Elite]] card at your location.

cards.flavor:
The power seized her, made her shudder and spasm.
Its energy united with hers, and then,
she opened her eyes…
cards.name: Uncage the Soul
cards.text: You may discard a [[Spell]] or [[Ritual]] asset you control. Play a [[Spell]] or [[Ritual]] card from your hand or discard pile, reducing its resource cost by 3.

cards.name: Dowsing Rod
cards.text: [action]: Investigate. Either use your [willpower] or get +1 [intellect] for this investigation. When you initiate this ability, choose one - Exhaust Dowsing Rod and place 1 doom on it to move to a connection location and get +2 skill value for this investigation. - If this investigation discovers the last clue at a location, ready Dowsing Rod and remove all doom from it.

cards.name: Onyx Pentacle
cards.text: [action]: Evade. Either use your [willpower] or get +1 [agility] for this evasion attempt. When you initiate this ability, choose one - Exhaust Onyx Pentacle and place 1 doom on it to target any enemy at your location or a connecting location, and get +3 skill value for this evasion attempt. - If you succeed by 2 or more, ready Onyx Pentacle and remove all doom from it.

cards.customization_change: When you play Makeshift Trap, you may increase or decrease its uses by 1. Forced - At the end of the round, if there are one or more enemies at attached location: Remove 1 time from Improved Trap. Fast. Play during any [fast] window. When you remove 1 or more time from Makeshift Trap, deal 1 damage to an enemy at attached location. Attach to your location, or to a revealed connecting location. Each non-[[Elite]] enemy at attached location get -1 fight and -1 evade, and cannot move or make attacks of opportunity. Customizable. Uses (2 time). When Makeshift Trap has no time, discard it and deal 3 damage to each enemy and investigator at attached location.
cards.customization_text: □ Improved Timer. When you play Makeshift Trap, you may increase or decrease its uses by 1. □ Tripwire. Only trigger Makeshift Trap's forced ability if there are 1 or more enemies at attached location. □□ Simple. Makeshift Trap gains fast and "play during any [fast] window." □□ Poisonous. When you remove 1 or more time from Makeshift Trap, deal 1 damage to an enemy at attached location. □□ Remote Configuration. When you play Makeshift Trap, you may attach it to a revealed connecting location. □□□ Net. Non-[[Elite]] enemies at attached location cannot move or make attacks of opportunity. □□□□ Explosive Device. When Makeshift Trap has no time and is discarded, deal 3 damage to each enemy and investigator at attached location.
cards.name: Makeshift Trap
cards.text: Customizable. Uses (2 time). If Makeshift Trap has no time, discard it. Attach to your location. Each non-[[Elite]] enemy at attached location get -1 fight and -1 evade. Forced - At the end of the round: Remove 1 time from Makeshift Trap.

cards.name: End of the Road
cards.text:
Fast. Play during your turn only if the final agenda is in play.
Draw 1 card, gain 1 resource, and gain 1 additional action. Remove End of the Road from the game.

cards.name: Exploit Weakness
cards.text:
Fast. Play before revealing a chaos token during an attack or evasion attempt you are performing, and only if the difficulty of this test is currently 0.
This test automatically succeeds. Instead of this test's normal effects, discard the attacked or evaded enemy (if it is [[Elite]], automatically evade it and deal it 3 damage instead).

cards.name: Shed a Light
cards.text:
Fast. Play before revealing a chaos token during an investigation you are performing, and only if the difficulty of this test is currently 0.
This test automatically succeeds. You discover 1 additional clue at this location and 1 additional clue at any location.

cards.name: Lifeline
cards.text:
Max 1 per turn.
Fast. Play when an investigator's turn would end.
That investigator may take X additional actions during their turn. X is the number of skill tests they failed during their turn. Exile Lifeline.

cards.name: Gumption
cards.text:
Max 1 committed per skill test.
You may commit Gumption to any type of skill test.
While Gumption is committed to a skill test, that test gets -2 difficulty.

cards.name: Baseball Bat
cards.text: [action]: Fight. You get +2 [combat] for this attack. This attack deals +1 damage. If a [skull] or [auto_fail] symbol is revealed during this attack, either (choose one): - Return Baseball Bat to your hand after this attack. - This attack deals an additional +1 damage. Discard Baseball Bat after this attack.

cards.name: Katja Eastbank
cards.text:
[reaction]: When you draw a non-weakness Card from the top of your deck, before resolving any of its effects, exhaust Katja Eastbank: Place that card facedown beneath her (limit 5 cards beneath her). Draw a new card to replace it.
[action]: Draw any card beneath Katja Eastbank.

cards.name: Old Keyring
cards.text: Uses (3 keys). If there are no keys on Old Keyring, discard it. [action]: Investigate. Your location gets -2 shroud for this investigation. If you succeed, remove 1 key from Old Keyring, and if this test's difficulty is 0, you discover 1 additional clue.

cards.name: Fickle Fortune
cards.text: Max 2 [[Dilemma]] per round. Revelation - You must decide (choose one): - Place 1 doom on the current agenda. Each investigator heals 3 damage and 3 horror. - Remove 1 doom from the current agenda. Each investigator takes 1 direct damage and 1 direct horror. Remove Fickle Fortune from the game.

cards.customization_change: Railshooter form: Manifest - Fight. Fight with any skill. This attack deals +1 damage. Telescanner form: Manifest - Investigate. Investigate with any skill. If you succeed, discover a clue at any revealed location instead of your location. Translocator form: Manifest - Evade. Attempt to evade with any skill. Before or after this attempt, you may move an investigator or a non-[[Elite]] enemy at your location to a connecting location, or vice versa. Realitycollapser form: Manifest - Text any skill (3). If you succeed, discard from play a non-weakness treachery that is not attached to an [[Elite]] enemy. Matterweaver form: Manifest - Choose an asset in your hand and test any skill (X), where X is that asset's cost. If you succeed, play that asset at no cost. Customizable. Uses (6 aether). If Hyperphysical Shotcaster has no aether, discard it. While using a Manifest ability, you get +2 skill value.
cards.customization_text: □□ Railshooter. Hyperphysical Shotcaster has this form: "Manifest - Fight. Fight with any skill. This attack deals +1 damage." □□ Telescanner. Hyperphysical Shotcaster has this form: "Manifest - Investigate. Investigate with any skill. If you succeed, discover a clue at any revealed location instead of your location." □□ Translocator. Hyperphysical Shotcaster has this form: "Manifest - Evade. Attempt to evade with any skill. Before or after this attempt, you may move an investigator or a non-[[Elite]] enemy at your location to a connecting location, or vice versa." □□ Realitycollapser. Hyperphysical Shotcaster has this form: "Manifest - Text any skill (3). If you succeed, discard from play a non-weakness treachery that is not attached to an [[Elite]] enemy." □□ Matterweaver. Hyperphysical Shotcaster has this form: "Manifest - Choose an asset in your hand and test any skill (X), where X is that asset's cost. If you succeed, play that asset at no cost." □□□□ Aetheric Link. Hyperphysical Shotcaster enters play with 2 additional aether. □□□□ Empowered Configuration. While using a Manifest ability, you get +2 skill value.
cards.name: Hyperphysical Shotcaster
cards.text: Customizable. Uses (4 aether). If Hyperphysical Shotcaster has no aether, discard it. [action] Spend 1 aether: Resolve the Manifest ability on the Hyperphysical Shotcaster's current form. [fast] Exhaust Hyperphysical Shotcaster: Change its form (to one you have unlocked on its upgrade sheet).

cards.name: Refine
cards.text:
As an additional cost to play Refine, spend an action.
Immediately mark a checkbox on an upgrade sheet for a customizable card you own, even if it is not in play.
Max once per game for each investigator.

cards.name: Flashlight
cards.text: Uses (4 supplies). [reaction] When you perform a skill test while investigating or attempting to evade, spend 1 supply: This test gets -2 difficulty. Card design by the Council-in-Exile at Arkham Nights 2020.

cards.name: Lurker in the Dark
cards.text: [guardian] investigator only. Spawn - Any connecting location. Lurker in the Dark can only be attacked or damaged using [[Weapon]] assets or [[Tactic]] events, and takes 1 fewer damage from each source.
